bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide for a method of redemption of landowner's coupons and hunter's coupons for the harvesting of deer by hunters on certain lands, to revise certain Game, Fish and Parks Commission rules relating to trophy buck licenses, and to provide certain penalties. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. Every big game license permitting the harvesting of a deer during the west river prairie deer season or the east river deer season shall have two coupons attached, each bearing the same serial number as the body of the permit, one coupon designated "hunter's coupon" and one coupon designated "landowner's coupon." Section 2. If the license holder harvests a deer on private land, the license holder shall promptly detach, date, sign, and deliver the landowner's coupon to the landowner. The landowner on or before February first following the year for which the license was valid, may deliver to the Department of Game, Fish and Parks the coupon and a completed affidavit on a form prescribed by the department that the deer for which the coupon was delivered was taken on the landowner's land. Upon receipt of the coupon and affidavit the department shall pay the landowner thirty dollars for each coupon from an applicable deer license. Landowner's coupons are not transferable. Any person attempting to collect any sum for any landowner's coupon in violation of this section is guilty of a Class 1 misdemeanor. Section 3. If the license holder harvests a deer on land open to public hunting or fails to harvest a deer, the license holder shall detach, date, sign, and deliver the hunter's coupon and a completed affidavit on a form prescribed by the department on or before February first following the year for which the license was valid to the Department of Game, Fish and Parks. The affidavit shall provide that the deer for which the license was issued was taken on land open to public hunting or provide that the license holder failed to harvest the deer. Upon receipt of the coupon and affidavit, the department shall pay the license holder twenty dollars for the coupon from the applicable deer license. Hunter coupons are not transferable. Any person attempting to collect any sum for any hunter coupon in violation of this section is guilty of a Class 1 misdemeanor. Section 4. The Game, Fish and Parks Commission may promulgate rules pursuant to chapter 1-26 to implement and administer coupon filings, affidavits, reimbursement procedures pursuant to this Act. Section 5. Revenue received by the department from the administration of the landowner's coupons and hunter's coupons less the cost of administration shall be used by the department to attempt to increase and acquire free public hunting access and to support expanded wildlife damage management programs. Section 6. The provisions of this Act do not apply to any resident farmer or rancher limited license issued pursuant to § 41-6-19.3. Section 7. That subdivision (1) of ARSD be amended to read as follows: (1) Only residents of the state may apply for a license, except for the eight percent additional number of licenses available to nonresidents as provided in § 41:06:20:02. The provisions of § 41:06:01:09 do not apply to this chapter. After the initial drawing, all leftover nonresident West River deer licenses are eliminated, and 250 300 resident "trophy buck deer" licenses and 250 300 nonresident "trophy buck deer" licenses are available to unsuccessful resident or nonresident applicants, respectively. These licenses are valid only on private land in any West River prairie deer unit; Section 8. That subdivision (27) of ARSD 41:06:02:03 be amended to read as follows: (27) Resident trophy buck license, $50 $100 ; Section 9. That subdivision (28) of ARSD 41:06:02:03 be amended to read as follows: (28) Nonresident trophy buck license, $300 $400 ;

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide for a method of redemption of landowner's coupons and hunter's coupons for the harvesting of deer by hunters on certain lands, to revise certain Game, Fish and Parks Commission rules relating to trophy buck licenses, and to provide certain penalties. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. Every big game license, except special youth licenses, permitting the harvesting of a deer during the west river prairie deer season or the east river deer season shall have a designated "landowner's coupon." Section 2. If the license holder harvests a deer on private land, the license holder shall promptly detach, date, sign, and deliver the landowner's coupon to the landowner. The landowner on or before February first following the year for which the license was valid, may deliver to the Department of Game, Fish and Parks the coupon and a completed affidavit on a form prescribed by the department that the deer for which the coupon was delivered was taken on the landowner's land. Upon receipt of the coupon and affidavit the department shall pay the landowner thirty dollars for each coupon from an applicable deer license. Landowner's coupons are not transferable. Any person attempting to collect any sum for any landowner's coupon in violation of this section is guilty of a Class 1 misdemeanor. Section 3. The Game, Fish and Parks Commission may promulgate rules pursuant to chapter 1-26 to implement and administer coupon filings, affidavits, reimbursement procedures pursuant to this Act. Section 4. Revenue received by the department from the administration of the landowner's coupons less the cost of administration shall be used by the department to attempt to acquire free public hunting access through lease agreements and to support expanded wildlife damage management programs. Section 5. The provisions of this Act do not apply to any resident farmer or rancher limited license issued pursuant to § 41-6-19.3. bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide for a method of redemption of landowner's coupons for the harvesting of deer by hunters on certain lands and to provide certain penalties. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. Every big game license, except special youth licenses, permitting the harvesting of a deer during the west river prairie deer season or the east river deer season shall have a designated "landowner's coupon" attached to a license which permits the harvest of an antlered deer. Section 2. If the license holder harvests a deer on private land, the license holder shall promptly detach, date, sign, and deliver the landowner's coupon to the landowner. The landowner on or before February first following the year for which the license was valid, may deliver to the Department of Game, Fish and Parks the coupon and a completed affidavit on a form prescribed by the department that the deer for which the coupon was delivered was taken on the landowner's land. Upon receipt of the coupon and affidavit the department shall pay the landowner thirty dollars for each coupon from an applicable deer license. Upon receipt of the coupon attached to a license permitting the harvest of only an antlerless deer and affidavit, the department shall pay the landowner fifteen dollars for each coupon from an applicable deer license. Landowner's coupons are not transferable. Any person attempting to collect any sum for any landowner's coupon in violation of this section is guilty of a Class 1 misdemeanor. Section 3. The Game, Fish and Parks Commission may promulgate rules pursuant to chapter 1-26 to implement and administer coupon filings, affidavits, and reimbursement procedures pursuant to this Act. Section 4. Revenue received by the department from the administration of the landowner's coupons less the cost of administration shall be used by the department to attempt to acquire free public hunting access through lease agreements and to support expanded wildlife damage management programs. Section 5. The provisions of this Act do not apply to any resident farmer or rancher limited license issued pursuant to § 41-6-19.3. FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to establish a license surcharge and fund for wildlife depredation and hunter access purposes. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. The Game, Fish and Parks Commission shall impose a surcharge in the amount of five dollars on each classification of hunting licenses issued by the Department of Game, Fish and Parks with the exception of resident predator/varmint licenses, migratory bird certification permits, youth deer licenses, and youth small game licenses. Revenue from the surcharge shall be deposited in a special fund known as the South Dakota sportsmen's access and landowner depredation fund, which is hereby established. Money in the fund is continuously appropriated for the purposes of this Act. Fifty percent of the money in the fund shall be available to landowners pursuant to procedures and amounts to be established in rules promulgated by the commission pursuant to chapter 1-26 for purposes of providing hunting access on the landowners' land and for wildlife depredation and damage management programs. Fifty percent of the money in the fund shall be available for purposes of acquiring free public hunting access by lease agreement. Section 2. The provisions of this Act do not apply to any resident farmer or rancher limited license issued pursuant to § 41-6-19.3. Section 3. The effective date of this Act is January 1, 1999. Section 4. This Act is repealed on anuary 1, 2002. BILL HISTORY 1/23/98 First read in House and referred to State Affairs.
